intro: Clermontia hualalaiensis, commonly known as the Hualalai clermonthe, is a rare endemic species native to the Hawaiian island of Hawaiʻi. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories, where it thrives in the cool, humid conditions. It has dark green, ovate leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its natural environment.
